Package fr.inria.boreal.jfbaget.irirefs

Class IRIRef

java.lang.Object
fr.inria.boreal.jfbaget.irirefs.IRIRef
public class IRIRef extends Object
Represents an Internationalized Resource Identifier (IRI) reference.

  • Constructor Details

    • IRIRef

      public IRIRef(String iriString) throws IRIParseException
      Constructs an IRI reference by parsing the given string, accepting any valid IRI reference form (IRI, absolute IRI or relative IRI).
      Parameters:
      iriString - String - the IRI string to parse
      Throws:
      IRIParseException - if the input is not a valid IRI reference

    • IRIRef

      public IRIRef(String iriString, IRIRef.IRITYPE type) throws IRIParseException
      Constructs an IRI reference from its string representation, validating it against a specific IRI type.
      Parameters:
      type - IRIRef.IRITYPE - the expected type of IRI, e.g., IRITYPE.ANY (for any IRI Reference), IRITYPE.IRI (for an IRI), IRITYPE.ABS (for an absolute IRI) or IRITYPE.REL (for a relative IRI).
      input - String - the IRI string to parse
      Throws:
      IRIParseException - if the input is not a valid IRI of the specified type, or if the parsed input does not consume the full string

    • IRIRef

      public IRIRef(fr.inria.boreal.jfbaget.nanoparse.IMatch parsed) throws IRIParseException, IllegalArgumentException
      Builds an IRI Reference from the result of an IRIParser.
      Parameters:
      parsed -
      Throws:
      IRIParseException
      IllegalArgumentException

  • Method Details

    • copy

      public IRIRef copy()
      Returns a deep copy of this IRIRef. The returned instance is mutable and independent from the original, regardless of whether this object is frozen or not.
      Returns:
      a new IRIRef instance with identical components

    • getScheme

      public String getScheme()
      Returns the scheme component of this IRI, or null if none is present.
      Returns:
      the scheme string (e.g., "http") or null

    • getUser

      public String getUser()
      Returns the user information component of the authority, or null if not specified.
      Returns:
      the user string (e.g., "user" in user@host) or null

    • getHost

      public String getHost()
      Returns the host component of the authority, or null if not specified.
      Returns:
      the host string (e.g., "example.org") or null

    • getPort

      public Integer getPort()
      Returns the port component of the authority, or null if not specified.
      Returns:
      the port number, or null

    • getPath

      public String getPath()
      Returns the full path of this IRI as a single string. Segments are joined using "/".
      Returns:
      the string representation of the path (e.g., "a/b/c")

    • getSegments

      public List<String> getSegments()
      Returns the individual segments of the path as an unmodifiable list.
      Returns:
      a read-only list of path segments

    • getQuery

      public String getQuery()
      Returns the query component of this IRI, or null if not present.
      Returns:
      the query string (e.g., "key=value") or null

    • recompose

      public String recompose()
      Reconstructs the string representation of this IRI reference from its parsed or constructed components.

      The resulting string follows the IRI recomposition rules as defined in RFC 3987, including the scheme, authority, path, query, and fragment components, if present.

      Returns:
      the full string representation of this IRI

    • recompose

      public String recompose(boolean ansiColor)

    • freeze

      public IRIRef freeze()
      Freezes this IRIRef, marking it as immutable and safe for use in equality and hashing operations. Once frozen, the internal state of the IRIRef may no longer be modified through resolution, normalization, or path manipulation.

      Freezing is only allowed after the IRIRef has been resolved, either explicitly via resolveInPlace(IRIRef, boolean) or implicitly via normalizeInPlace(). Attempting to freeze an unresolved IRIRef will result in an exception.

      Returns:
      this IRIRef, for fluent chaining
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the IRIRef has not been resolved
      See Also:
      • resolveInPlace(IRIRef, boolean)
      • normalizeInPlace()

    • recompose

      public StringBuilder recompose(StringBuilder builder)
      Appends the string representation of this IRIRef to the given StringBuilder, following the standard IRI recomposition rules from RFC 3987.

      The output includes the scheme, authority, path, query, and fragment, when present. This method is useful for efficient concatenation or partial recomposition.

      Parameters:
      builder - the StringBuilder to append the IRI representation to
      Returns:
      the same StringBuilder, allowing for method chaining

    • recomposeColor

      public void recomposeColor(StringBuilder builder)

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns the standard string representation of this IRIRef, as defined by RFC 3987.

      This is equivalent to calling recompose() and includes the scheme, authority, path, query, and fragment components, when present.

      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      the IRIRef as a string

    • resolveInPlace

      public IRIRef resolveInPlace(IRIRef base, boolean strict) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Resolves this IRI reference against a given base IRI, following the algorithm defined in RFC 3986, Section 5.2. This method modifies the current IRI in place by merging it with the base, normalizing the resulting path, and inheriting components such as scheme, authority, or query when appropriate.

      If strict is false, the resolution tolerates non-standard behavior where the scheme of a relative IRI may match the base and be removed. This is sometimes allowed for backward compatibility with legacy implementations.

      Parameters:
      base - the absolute IRIRef to resolve against; must not be relative
      strict - whether to perform strict RFC-compliant resolution (true), or allow legacy compatibility behavior (false)
      Returns:
      this IRIRef, updated with the resolved components (for method chaining)
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the base IRI is not absolute

    • resolveInPlace

      public IRIRef resolveInPlace(IRIRef base) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Resolves this IRI reference against the given base IRI using strict resolution rules, as defined in RFC 3986, Section 5.2.

      This is equivalent to calling resolveInPlace(IRIRef, boolean) with strict set to true. The resolution strictly adheres to the standard IRI resolution algorithm, and does not apply any legacy compatibility rules.

      Parameters:
      base - the absolute IRIRef to resolve against
      Returns:
      this IRIRef, updated with the resolved components (for method chaining)
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the base IRI is not absolute
      See Also:
      • resolveInPlace(IRIRef, boolean)

    • resolve

      public IRIRef resolve(IRIRef base) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException

      public IRIRef resolve(IRIRef base, boolean strict) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException
